mulan.evaluation.measure

Interface Measure

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AverageMAE, AveragePrecision, AverageRelativeMAE, AverageRelativeRMSE, AverageRMSE, BipartitionMeasureBase, ClassificationMeasureBase, ConfidenceMeasureBase, Coverage, ErrorSetSize, ExampleBasedAccuracy, ExampleBasedBipartitionMeasureBase, ExampleBasedConfidenceMeasureBase, ExampleBasedFMeasure, ExampleBasedPrecision, ExampleBasedRecall, ExampleBasedSpecificity, GeometricMeanAverageInterpolatedPrecision, GeometricMeanAveragePrecision, HammingLoss, HierarchicalLoss, IsError, LabelBasedAUC, LabelBasedAveragePrecision, LabelBasedBipartitionMeasureBase, LabelBasedFMeasure, LabelBasedPrecision, LabelBasedRecall, LabelBasedSpecificity, LogLoss, LossBasedBipartitionMeasureBase, LossBasedConfidenceMeasureBase, LossBasedRankingMeasureBase, MacroAUC, MacroFMeasure, MacroPrecision, MacroRecall, MacroSpecificity, MeanAverageInterpolatedPrecision, MeanAveragePrecision, MeanSquaredError, MeasureBase, MicroAUC, MicroFMeasure, MicroPrecision, MicroRecall, MicroSpecificity, OneError, RankingLoss, RankingMeasureBase, RegressionMeasureBase, RootMeanSquaredError, SubsetAccuracy

    public interface Measure
    Interface for a measure, used to evaluate the performance of a multi-label learner on when performing multi-label learning task. Various measures capture different characteristics of a learning task performance.
    Author:
    Jozef Vilcek

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getIdealValue()
      Gets an 'ideal' value of a measure.
      String getName()
      Gets the name of a measure.
      double getValue()
      Gets the value of a measure.
      boolean handlesMissingValues()
      Returns true if the measure handles missing ground truth values, false otherwise.
      Measure makeCopy()
      Creates a deep copy of the given measure using serialization.
      void reset()
      Resets the cumulated measure value, so the process of computation can be started from beginning (e.g.
      void update(MultiLabelOutput prediction, GroundTruth truth)
      Computes the value of a measure for the given prediction and true labels.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Gets the name of a measure.
        Returns:
        the name of a measure.

      • getValue

        double getValue()
        Gets the value of a measure. The measure is incrementally accumulated for learner's prediction by each update(MultiLabelOutput, GroundTruth) call. The value returned by the method, returns sum of all update calls divided by the number of calls (average of all measures for all predictions).
        Returns:
        the average measure value computed so far

      • getIdealValue

        double getIdealValue()
        Gets an 'ideal' value of a measure. The 'ideal' means, that the value represents the best achievable performance of a learner for an prediction of a multi-label task and associated true labels.
        Returns:
        the ideal value

      • update

        void update(MultiLabelOutput prediction,
            GroundTruth truth)
        Computes the value of a measure for the given prediction and true labels. The immediate value of a measure is returned and result is added to the cumulated measure value.
        Parameters:
        prediction - the prediction for which measure has to be computed
        truth - ground truth for given prediction
        See Also:
        getValue()

      • makeCopy

        Measure makeCopy()
          throws Exception
        Creates a deep copy of the given measure using serialization.
        Returns:
        a deep copy of the measure
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs while making copy of the measure.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets the cumulated measure value, so the process of computation can be started from beginning (e.g. for a new series of outputs from learning task).

      • handlesMissingValues

        boolean handlesMissingValues()
        Returns true if the measure handles missing ground truth values, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if missing values are handled, false otherwise
